bold_statement_opener.formula: One of the [SUPERLATIVE] things I've [EXPERIENCED] is [SPECIFIC EXAMPLE]
bold_statement_opener.example: One of the most impressive things I've seen a designer make all year is Meng To's Dreamcut.

components.follow_up: Explain why it matters + transition to guest introduction

bold_statement_opener.usage_notes: Creates immediate credibility and intrigue. Must back up claim with substance.

question_hook.formula: Did you know that [SURPRISING FACT]? + [GUEST INTRODUCTION]
question_hook.example: Did you know that the very first interface designer at Adobe was also the first designer to work on Figma?

components.follow_up: Immediately introduce the guest with their credentials

question_hook.usage_notes: Ridd's favorite opener. Engages brain immediately and creates curiosity gap.

personal_betting.formula: I'm willing to bet that [RELATABLE ASSUMPTION] + [GUEST AUTHORITY ESTABLISHMENT]
personal_betting.example: I'm willing to bet that you have been on Smashing Magazine at some point in the last 18 years...

authority_builders: has been doing X for Y years

personal_betting.usage_notes: Creates relatability before establishing authority. Works well for established industry figures.

irreverent_casual.example: wtf is a prototype now?? we've made incremental progress for a decade+ and then everything changed overnight
irreverent_casual.usage_notes: Use sparingly. Works well for disruptive/transformative topics. Ridd notes it 'performed quite well.'

critical_success_factors: Must maintain balance between editorial authority and conversational accessibility
Every piece should pass the 'will this help designers grow?' filter
Avoid chasing engagement metrics at expense of educational value
Preserve transparency about editorial process and quality standards
usage_priorities: 1. Always include signature phrase 'a *lot* more' in highlight lists
2. Use question hooks when possible for maximum engagement
3. Include parenthetical asides for conversational authenticity
4. Maintain specific examples over generic statements
5. Create curiosity gaps without being misleading
adaptation_guidelines: Templates are starting points - adapt based on specific content and guest
Voice elements should feel natural, not forced
Quality standards are non-negotiable even when using templates
Personal investment and editorial perspective must be authentic
